Comment: Exactly! Democrats think it's a messaging issue and not a marked shift to a pro-wall street platform that has gutted the wealth of the bottom 50% of the nation.  The New Deal coalition dissolved after LBJ signed the civil rights movement so Democrats shifted right on economic issues while peppering in dog whistle tough on crime/welfare reform. Then every fucking election since Clinton have nominated a centrist (or in Obama's case a progressive speaker with neolib ideology) that prioritizes college educated suburbanites.  Then dems look around wondering why the working class is slowly abandoning them. The right wing messaging on social issues only work because Democrats don't have an economic platform that supercedes that.  A lot of socially conservative Democrats stayed with the party through the 70s because the pocketbook supercedes biases. Once the economic message of Democrats was indistinguishable from the conservatives, of course the old working class said "well I guess I'll vote for the racist."  People seem to forget fucking Indiana went for Obama in 08 but Romney in 12. Why is that? Because Obama's message came across as the type to lift the working class up. After bailing out Wall Street, those rural white voters in Indiana who voted for Obama said "fuck that."
